conversation.content: I need—wait no—I have to change my card. Before it bills. Tomorrow I think?

Okay, let me pull up your account here... *exhales* alright, so I'm seeing your next billing date is actually December 15th, not tomorrow, which gives us, um... plenty of time to get this sorted for you.
December—no that can't—I got an email. Said payment soon. Is my service gonna stop?

Oh I see what happened, so the email you got was probably the, er... what's it called... the reminder notice we send 7 days before billing. Your account number A-5472-BK9 is totally fine, nothing's shutting off or anything.
But the card—it's canceled. Got stolen. What if—what happens if—

*sharp inhale* Right, okay, so we can absolutely update that right now. I just need to, hmm... verify a few things first. Can you give me the last four digits of the card currently on file? Should be ending in something like 4 digits.
It's—wait let me—no that's the new one. Old one ends... 8923?
Perfect, yeah that matches what I have here, 8923. So for the new card, I'll need the full number, and then, uh—sorry, also the expiration date and that 3-digit security code on the back.
Can't mess this up. If it declines—I can't—we need the service.

*soft exhale* Hey, I totally get it. Look, what I can do is, er... once we add the new card, I'll run a test authorization for just $1.00 to make absolutely sure it's working before your actual billing date.
Test? That's—wait how does—will that charge me?

No no, it's not a real charge, it's more like a... hmm, how do I explain this... basically we ping your bank, they confirm the card's valid, and the dollar drops off within 24 to 48 hours. Your December bill of $127.89 will process normally on the 15th.
Okay so—no wait—the number is 4455... 6789... then what?
Alright, I need, let's see... 4455-6789 and then the remaining 8 digits whenever you're ready.
0011-2233. Expires—wait is that—yeah, 07/26.
Got it, 07/26, and then that, uh—the CVV, that little security code?
445. This will work right? Won't bounce?
*exhales* So I've updated everything in the system, account A-5472-BK9 now has the new card ending in 2233, and... yep, the test authorization just went through successfully. You're all set.
It worked? Already? So December 15th—it'll just—automatically?

Exactly, yeah. December 15th at 12:01 AM Pacific, it'll process your regular monthly charge of $127.89 to the new card. And actually, I'm sending you a confirmation email right now to the address on file, so you'll have all this in writing too.
